topic.title: Is it possible to change port 35095?
topic.body:
Hello!
My VPN is blocking port 35098
Is there any way that I can change it to another number?

1547371240_1LrJNXF9nevWkNxvqHRKEzrsw1Mbe.body:
Zeronet config was excatly the thing. Thanks, it solved my problem :-)



The problem I was having.
I use Mullvad and they have an option to open ports, but you can't choose the port number yourself, so you are given a specific number. The error came when the Mullvad client is connected. In the top of the Dashboard page it said the port was closed. And when I try to publish my website this error came:
1) Content publish fail.
2) No peers found, but your content is ready to publish.
When I turn off the VPN the port says it's open and I'm able to publish content.

Now that I changed the port number to the one I got from Mullvad there is no problem.
